ericssonAlarmXpathMIB.name: ericssonAlarmXpathMIB

revisions.description: Fixed duplicate object names issue, by replacing prefix eriAlarm with prefix eriAlarmX where needed. Increased overall size of Additional Info. Added new OBJECT-TYPE: eriAlarmXNObjAppendedAdditionalInfo. Added new IMPORT: EriAppendedAdditionalInfo. Fixed CONFORMANCE GROUPS issue by separating recently added OBJECT-TYPES into new CONFORMANCE GROUPS. Added new GROUPS: eriAlarmXActiveAlarmsAdditionalInfoGroup, eriAlarmXAlertsAdditionalInfoGroup, eriAlarmXRecordTypeGroup. Added more detail to DESCRIPTION for each REVISION. Document number: 11/196 03-CXC 172 7549, Rev C.

Updated as part of ERICSSON ALARM MIB 2.1 package. Added new OBJECT-TYPES: eriAlarmNObjAdditionalInfo, eriAlarmNObjMoreAdditionalInfo, eriAlarmNObjRecordType, eriAlarmActiveAdditionalInfo, eriAlarmAlertAdditionalInfo. Added new IMPORTS: EriAdditionalInfo, EriLargeAdditionalInfo, EriAlarmRecordType. Document number: 11/196 03-CXC 172 7549, Rev B.
Initial version of this MIB module. Document number: 11/196 03-CXC 172 7549, Rev A.

ericssonAlarmXpathMIB.description: This MIB Module is an Ericsson-wide SNMP interface for managing alarms. Main inputs to the MIB design are the 3GPP Alarm IRP and X.733. However, an important restriction is that the MIB only represents the resource view and not management activities like acknowledgment, etc. It describes generic notifications used to send alarm state changes and a table which represents the current active alarms in the system. The MIB supports both stateful alarms and stateless alerts. It is important to identify clearly what is to be considered the same alarm object instance. All unique alarm *types* are identified by 'AlarmType'. An AlarmType is a one-to-one mapping with X.733 EventType, ProbabableCause and SpecificProblem. A pair of integers are used to specify the alarm type. A unique alarm object *instance* is the combination of YangNodeInstance and AlarmType. In this way, there is no ambiguity about how alarm and alarm clear correlation should be performed: the same YANG resource instance and AlarmType shall be used. The same is true for changing existing alarm states. Severity, Additional Text and Additional Info can be changed on an existing alarm. For stateful alarms there are notifications to report a new alarm and a cleared alarm. Changing an alarm is done via the new alarm notification. The management system shall match the alarm by using alarm type and YangNodeInstance in the same way as for clear notifications. The MIB has different notifications for different severities in order to support SNMP managers which maps severities based on notification identifiers. For stateless alerts, there are generic notifications to send the alerts with different severities. NOTE - Updated Definition of Alerts in TEA (The Ericsson Architecture): Alerts are used by service management systems to evaluate service impact, and are only applicable to very specific state changes with potential service impact like restart and redundancy shifts. Alerts SHALL NOT be used for fault indication. Alerts should always have Perceived Severity Indeterminate, and should only be sent using eriAlarmXIndAlert notification. The other severity alert notifications should not be used, and are only present in this specification for backward compatibility reasons. A table lists all active alarms so that a manager can read an initial state and also perform an alarm resynchronization procedure. There is also a table of latest stateless alarms. Since the stateless alarms do not have a corresponding clear message, the table size is limited by the agent instrumentation. The MIB supports two approaches for detecting lost notifications: - sequence numbers are used in the alarm notifications, and are shown in the active alarm table. The last used sequence number can be read in a scalar variable - a time stamp indicates the last time alarm tables were updated. Heartbeat mechanisms are supported both in pull and push mode: - Pull: the classical SNMP polling where a manager polls a scalar variable, for example the last sequence number used - Push: the agent can be configured to send heartbeat notifications. These contains the last used sequence numbers. Document number: 11/196 03-CXC 172 7549.

eriAlarmXSumIndeterminate.name: eriAlarmXSumIndeterminate
eriAlarmXSumIndeterminate.description: This object shows the number of currently active alarms with perceived severity 'indeterminate'. Note that only stateful alarms are included.

eriAlarmXSumCritical.name: eriAlarmXSumCritical
eriAlarmXSumCritical.description: This object shows the number of currently active alarms with perceived severity 'critical'. Note that only stateful alarms are included.

eriAlarmXSumMajor.name: eriAlarmXSumMajor
eriAlarmXSumMajor.description: This object shows the number of currently active alarms with perceived severity 'major'. Note that only stateful alarms are included.

eriAlarmXSumMinor.name: eriAlarmXSumMinor
eriAlarmXSumMinor.description: This object shows the number of currently active alarms with perceived severity 'minor'. Note that only stateful alarms are included.

eriAlarmXSumWarning.name: eriAlarmXSumWarning
eriAlarmXSumWarning.description: This object shows the number of currently active alarms with perceived severity 'warning'. Note that only stateful alarms are included.

eriAlarmXNObjAdditionalText.name: eriAlarmXNObjAdditionalText
eriAlarmXNObjAdditionalText.description: This is a scalar variable only used in notifications. It is size ranged with a smaller size than the corresponding type used in the active alarm table. This is in order to make sure that all alarm information will fit into one UDP packet. The additional text can be further appended by using the dedicated append notification.

eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalText.name: eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalText
eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalText.description: This is a scalar variable only used in notifications. It tells the management system that the additional text will be appended by subsequent append additional text notifications. NOTE: this object exists simply because of the limitations of PDU size inherent in SNMP over UDP, which limits the size of the PDU+headers to under 1500 octets. Otherwise, the notification will be fragmented.

eriAlarmXNObjResourceId.name: eriAlarmXNObjResourceId
eriAlarmXNObjResourceId.description: This is a scalar variable only used in notifications. It tells the management system that there is an SNMP-based Resource ID (OID) that identifies the alarming resource. NOTE: this object exists simply because of the limitations of PDU size inherent in SNMP over UDP, which limits the size of the PDU+headers to under 1500 octets. Otherwise, the notification will be fragmented.

eriAlarmXNObjAdditionalInfo.name: eriAlarmXNObjAdditionalInfo
eriAlarmXNObjAdditionalInfo.description: This is a scalar variable only used in notifications. It is size ranged with a smaller size than the corresponding type used in the active alarm table. This is in order to make sure that all alarm information will fit into one UDP packet. The additional info can be further appended by using the dedicated append notification.

eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalInfo.name: eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalInfo
eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalInfo.description: This is a scalar variable only used in notifications. It tells the management system that the additional info will be appended by subsequent append additional info notifications. NOTE: this object exists simply because of the limitations of PDU size inherent in SNMP over UDP, which limits the size of the PDU+headers to under 1500 octets. Otherwise, the notification will be fragmented.

eriAlarmXNObjRecordType.name: eriAlarmXNObjRecordType
eriAlarmXNObjRecordType.description: This is a scalar variable only used in notifications. It tells the management system whether the alarm record being reported in the notification represents a new alarm instance or an update of an existing alarm instance.

eriAlarmXNObjAppendedAdditionalInfo.name: eriAlarmXNObjAppendedAdditionalInfo
eriAlarmXNObjAppendedAdditionalInfo.description: This scalar variable is used for spillover of the additional info in the append trap.

eriAlarmXActiveNumber.name: eriAlarmXActiveNumber
eriAlarmXActiveNumber.description: This object shows the total number of currently active alarms, i.e. the total number of entries in the Alarm Table.

eriAlarmXActiveLastChanged.name: eriAlarmXActiveLastChanged
eriAlarmXActiveLastChanged.reference: DateAndTime is defined in RFC 2579, page 18
eriAlarmXActiveLastChanged.description: A timestamp when the active alarm table was last changed. The value can be used by a manager to initiate an alarm resynchronization procedure. NOTE: All fields of the DateAndTime MUST be filled out, including the hours and minutes from UTC. As such, the value should be 11 octets long.

eriAlarmXActiveLastSequenceNo.name: eriAlarmXActiveLastSequenceNo
eriAlarmXActiveLastSequenceNo.description: The last used sequence number for a alarm state change notification. A management system can poll this variable in order to detect lost alarm change notifications.

eriAlarmXActiveTableURL.name: eriAlarmXActiveTableURL
eriAlarmXActiveTableURL.description: A URL pointing to a location where the contents of the alarm table can be retrieved as a file. The actual format of the file is out of the scope of this MIB and can be found in the system documentation. A Uniform Resource Locator in accordance with RFC 4248. A string of length zero means that the agent does not have a URL to provide.

eriAlarmXActiveAlarmTable.name: eriAlarmXActiveAlarmTable
eriAlarmXActiveAlarmTable.description: This table list all active alarms in the system. The aspect is the resource view of the alarms, not the administrative states and processes performed by users. The number of entries, active alarms, can be read in eriAlarmXActiveNumber. Entries are created when a resource has a new alarm state. If the same resource has several active alarms, with different Alarm Types, this will be represented as separate rows. Rows disappear whenever the alarm is cleared in the resource. Rows can be changed when an alarm changes severity, additional text or additional info. Alarms where the clear state cannot be detected by the resource are not represented in this table. The contents of the active alarm table can also be fetched using file transfer. eriAlarmXActiveTableURL provides a URL to the file.

eriAlarmXActiveAlarmEntry.name: eriAlarmXActiveAlarmEntry
eriAlarmXActiveAlarmEntry.description: One entry in the table holds one active alarm for a given resource. Entries are created by the system when a resource has a new alarm state. Entries are deleted by the system when a resource alarm state is cleared. Alarm severity, additional text and additional info can later be changed in a row.

eriAlarmXActiveIndex.name: eriAlarmXActiveIndex
eriAlarmXActiveIndex.description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each alarm. It is recommended that values are assigned contiguously starting from 1. The value for each alarm must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity to the next re-initialization. Note that this index should not be used for alarm synchronization purposes since the 'logical' index for an alarm is - eriAlarmXActiveMajorType - eriAlarmXActiveMinorType - eriAlarmXActiveYangNodeInstance

eriAlarmXActiveMajorType.name: eriAlarmXActiveMajorType
eriAlarmXActiveMajorType.description: In combination with eriAlarmXActiveMinorType, this provides a unique identification of the fault type. Different YANG Schema Nodes and instances can share alarm types, but if the same YANG resource instance reports the same alarm type, it is to be considered as the same alarm state. The alarm type is a simplification of the different X.733 and 3GPP alarm IRP alarm correlation mechanisms based on EventType, ProbableCause, SpecificProblem and NotificationId. For systems where eriAlarmXActiveMajorType is not needed for identification purposes, it is not used and MUST be zero-valued.

eriAlarmXActiveMinorType.name: eriAlarmXActiveMinorType
eriAlarmXActiveMinorType.description: In combination with with eriAlarmXActiveMajorType, this provides a unique identification of the fault type, not including the YANG Schema Node. Different YANG Schema Nodes and instances can share alarm types, but if the same YANG resource instance reports the same alarm type it is to be considered as the same alarm state. The alarm type is a simplification of the different X.733 and 3GPP alarm IRP alarm correlation mechanisms based on EventType, ProbableCause, SpecificProblem and NotificationId.

eriAlarmXActiveSpecificProblem.name: eriAlarmXActiveSpecificProblem
eriAlarmXActiveSpecificProblem.description: This is a clear-text unique identification of the alarm type. There is a one-to-one mapping between eriAlarmXActiveSpecificProblem and [eriAlarmXActiveMajorType,eriAlarmXActiveMinorType]

eriAlarmXActiveYangNodeInstance.name: eriAlarmXActiveYangNodeInstance
eriAlarmXActiveYangNodeInstance.reference: YANG module ericsson-yang-types; RFC 7950 , The YANG 1.1 Data Modeling Language
eriAlarmXActiveYangNodeInstance.description: An Abridged YANG Instance-Identifier that references the alarming resource within the Managed Element.

eriAlarmXActiveEventType.name: eriAlarmXActiveEventType
eriAlarmXActiveEventType.reference: ITU Recommendation X.733, 'Information Technology - Open Systems Interconnection - System Management: Alarm Reporting Function', 1992
eriAlarmXActiveEventType.description: The event type as defined in X.733/X.736.

eriAlarmXActiveEventTime.name: eriAlarmXActiveEventTime
eriAlarmXActiveEventTime.reference: DateAndTime is defined in RFC 2579, page 18. ITU Recommendation X.733, 'Information Technology - Open Systems Interconnection - System Management: Alarm Reporting Function', 1992
eriAlarmXActiveEventTime.description: A time stamp of the alarm state change event. Note that this variable represents the last change of the alarm state, like changed severity or additional text/info. If the alarm has not changed state this variable represents the alarm raise time and will be the same as originalEventTime. NOTE: All fields of the DateAndTime MUST be filled out, including the hours and minutes from UTC. As such, the value should be 11 octets long.

eriAlarmXActiveOriginalEventTime.name: eriAlarmXActiveOriginalEventTime
eriAlarmXActiveOriginalEventTime.reference: DateAndTime is defined in RFC 2579, page 18.
eriAlarmXActiveOriginalEventTime.description: The time-stamp of the original alarm raise notification. NOTE: All fields of the DateAndTime MUST be filled out, including the hours and minutes from UTC. As such, the value should be 11 octets long.

eriAlarmXActiveProbableCause.name: eriAlarmXActiveProbableCause
eriAlarmXActiveProbableCause.reference: ITU Recommendation X.733, 'Information Technology - Open Systems Interconnection - System Management: Alarm Reporting Function', 1992
eriAlarmXActiveProbableCause.description: The probable cause for the alarm originally defined by X.733 and subsequent standards. See also the ERICSSON-ALARM-PC-MIB. Due to the history of problems in maintaining a standardized probable cause the probable cause is not unique. A best effort mapping of the alarm to existing probable causes are used.

eriAlarmXActiveSeverity.name: eriAlarmXActiveSeverity
eriAlarmXActiveSeverity.reference: ITU Recommendation X.733, 'Information Technology - Open Systems Interconnection - System Management: Alarm Reporting Function', 1992
eriAlarmXActiveSeverity.description: The severity of the alarm as defined by X.733. Note that this may not be the original severity since the alarm may have changed severity.

eriAlarmXActiveOriginalSeverity.name: eriAlarmXActiveOriginalSeverity
eriAlarmXActiveOriginalSeverity.description: The original severity as reported by the alarm raise notification.

eriAlarmXActiveAdditionalText.name: eriAlarmXActiveAdditionalText
eriAlarmXActiveAdditionalText.reference: ITU Recommendation X.733, 'Information Technology - Open Systems Interconnection - System Management: Alarm Reporting Function', 1992
eriAlarmXActiveAdditionalText.description: A user friendly text describing the alarm. The text is both static depending on the alarm type (probable cause), and dynamic depending on YANG resource instance and other conditions. This string is longer than the corresponding varbind in the notification in order to manage large strings.

eriAlarmXActiveOrigAdditionalText.name: eriAlarmXActiveOrigAdditionalText
eriAlarmXActiveOrigAdditionalText.reference: ITU Recommendation X.733, 'Information Technology - Open Systems Interconnection - System Management: Alarm Reporting Function', 1992
eriAlarmXActiveOrigAdditionalText.description: A user-friendly text describing the alarm. The text is both static depending on the alarm type (probable cause), and dynamic depending on YANG resource instance and other conditions. This is the original text as reported by the first alarm notification, after which it is not altered.

eriAlarmXActiveResourceId.name: eriAlarmXActiveResourceId
eriAlarmXActiveResourceId.description: In case the alarm refers to an object which is instrumented by SNMP this variable indicates the corresponding OID for the YANG resource instance.

eriAlarmXActiveAdditionalInfo.name: eriAlarmXActiveAdditionalInfo
eriAlarmXActiveAdditionalInfo.description: Additional Information for the alarm, structured in a way that is suitable for machine to machine communication. This string is longer than the corresponding varbind in the notification in order to manage large strings.

eriAlarmXAlertNumber.name: eriAlarmXAlertNumber
eriAlarmXAlertNumber.description: The number of rows in the alert table.

eriAlarmXAlertLastChanged.name: eriAlarmXAlertLastChanged
eriAlarmXAlertLastChanged.reference: DateAndTime is defined in RFC 2579, page 18
eriAlarmXAlertLastChanged.description: A timestamp when the alert table was last changed. Can be used by a manager to initiate a an update of alerts procedure. NOTE: All fields of the DateAndTime MUST be filled out, including the hours and minutes from UTC. As such, the value should be 11 octets long.

eriAlarmXAlertLastSequenceNo.name: eriAlarmXAlertLastSequenceNo
eriAlarmXAlertLastSequenceNo.description: The last sequence number used in alert notifications. This can be used to detect a lost notification.

eriAlarmXAlertTableURL.name: eriAlarmXAlertTableURL
eriAlarmXAlertTableURL.description: A URL pointing to a location where the contents of alert table can be retrieved as a file. The format of the file is out of the scope of this MIB and system dependant. A Uniform Resource Locator in accordance with RFC 4248.

eriAlarmXAlertTable.name: eriAlarmXAlertTable
eriAlarmXAlertTable.description: This table lists the last alerts in the system. An alert is a stateless event, that is no clear notification will be sent. Rows in this table are created when a new alert event is detected. Rows are deleted by the instrumentation at a predefined size or age.

eriAlarmXAlertEntry.name: eriAlarmXAlertEntry
eriAlarmXAlertEntry.description: One entry in the table holds one alert for a given resource. Rows in this table are created when a new alert is detected. Rows are deleted by the instrumentation at a predefined size or age.

eriAlarmXAlertMajorType.name: eriAlarmXAlertMajorType
eriAlarmXAlertMajorType.description: In combination with eriAlarmXAlertMinorType, this provides unique identification of the alert. This is a simplification of the different X.733 and 3GPP alarm IRP alarm correlation mechanisms based on EventType, ProbableCause, SpecificProblem and NotificationId.

eriAlarmXAlertMinorType.name: eriAlarmXAlertMinorType
eriAlarmXAlertMinorType.description: In combination with eriAlarmXAlertMajorType, this provides a unique identification of the alert. This is a simplification of the different X.733 and 3GPP alarm IRP alarm correlation mechanisms based on EventType, ProbableCause, SpecificProblem and NotificationId.

eriAlarmXAlertSpecificProblem.name: eriAlarmXAlertSpecificProblem
eriAlarmXAlertSpecificProblem.description: This is a clear-text unique identification of the alert type. There is a one-to-one mapping between eriAlarmXAlertSpecificProblem and [eriAlarmXAlertMajorType, eriAlarmXAlertMinorType]

eriAlarmXAlertYangNodeInstance.name: eriAlarmXAlertYangNodeInstance
eriAlarmXAlertYangNodeInstance.reference: YANG module ericsson-yang-types; RFC 7950 , The YANG 1.1 Data Modeling Language
eriAlarmXAlertYangNodeInstance.description: An Abridged YANG Instance-Identifier that references a resource within the Managed Element.

eriAlarmXAlertEventType.name: eriAlarmXAlertEventType
eriAlarmXAlertEventType.reference: ITU Recommendation X.733, 'Information Technology - Open Systems Interconnection - System Management: Alarm Reporting Function', 1992
eriAlarmXAlertEventType.description: The event type as defined in X.733/X.736.

eriAlarmXAlertEventTime.name: eriAlarmXAlertEventTime
eriAlarmXAlertEventTime.reference: DateAndTime is defined in RFC 2579, page 18. ITU Recommendation X.733, 'Information Technology - Open Systems Interconnection - System Management: Alarm Reporting Function', 1992
eriAlarmXAlertEventTime.description: A time stamp of the alert. NOTE: All fields of the DateAndTime MUST be filled out, including the hours and minutes from UTC. As such, the value should be 11 octets long.

eriAlarmXAlertProbableCause.name: eriAlarmXAlertProbableCause
eriAlarmXAlertProbableCause.reference: ITU Recommendation X.733, 'Information Technology - Open Systems Interconnection - System Management: Alarm Reporting Function', 1992
eriAlarmXAlertProbableCause.description: The probable cause, originally defined by X.733 and subsequent standards. See also the ERICSSON-ALARM-PC-MIB. Due to the history of problems in maintaining a standardized probable cause the probable cause is not unique. A best effort mapping of the alert to existing probable causes are used.

eriAlarmXAlertSeverity.name: eriAlarmXAlertSeverity
eriAlarmXAlertSeverity.reference: ITU Recommendation X.733, 'Information Technology - Open Systems Interconnection - System Management: Alarm Reporting Function', 1992
eriAlarmXAlertSeverity.description: The severity of the alert as defined by X.733

eriAlarmXAlertAdditionalText.name: eriAlarmXAlertAdditionalText
eriAlarmXAlertAdditionalText.reference: ITU Recommendation X.733, 'Information Technology - Open Systems Interconnection - System Management: Alarm Reporting Function', 1992
eriAlarmXAlertAdditionalText.description: A user friendly text describing the alert. The text is both static depending on the alert type and dynamic depending on YANG resource instance and other conditions.

eriAlarmXAlertResourceId.name: eriAlarmXAlertResourceId
eriAlarmXAlertResourceId.description: In case the alert refers to an object which is instrumented by SNMP this variable indicates the corresponding OID for the YANG resource instance.

eriAlarmXAlertAdditionalInfo.name: eriAlarmXAlertAdditionalInfo
eriAlarmXAlertAdditionalInfo.description: Additional Information for the alert, structured in a way that is suitable for machine to machine communication. This string is longer than the corresponding varbind in the notification in order to manage large strings.

eriAlarmXHbInterval.name: eriAlarmXHbInterval
eriAlarmXHbInterval.description: The notification eriAlarmXHeartBeatNotif will be sent every eriAlarmXHbInterval. Managers can subscribe to the notification using the SNMP framework MIBS by using the snmpNotifyName 'heartbeat'. (SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB, snmpNotifyTable)

eriAlarmXIndeterminate.name: eriAlarmXIndeterminate
eriAlarmXIndeterminate.description: This notification is sent when a resource detects a new alarm state with severity indeterminate. The notification is also used to change severity, additional text and/or additional info of an alarm. The eriAlarmXNObjRecordType varbind will indicate whether this is a new alarm instance or a change to an existing alarm instance. The combination of YangNodeInstance and MajorType/MinorType is always unique and can be used by management systems to correlate alarm, alarm change, and alarm clear. A corresponding row will be created in the Alarm Table. The sequence number will increase for every notification and can be used to detect lost notifications. A management system should be prepared for appending text to additional text, indicated by the eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalText varbind, and sent with eriAlarmXAppendInfo. (Note do not confuse this with a change of additional text.) A management system should be prepared for appending text to additional info, indicated by the eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalInfo varbind, and sent with eriAlarmXAppendInfo. (Note do not confuse this with a change of additional info.) A management system should also be prepared to receive a resource ID (OID) identifying the alarming resource if the system sending the notification can provide that information. In that case, eriAlarmXNObjResourceId will be set to 'true' and the resource ID will be sent in an eriAlarmXAppendInfo notification.

eriAlarmXWarning.name: eriAlarmXWarning
eriAlarmXWarning.description: This notification is sent when a resource detects a new alarm state with severity warning. The notification is also used to change severity, additional text and/or additional info of an alarm. The eriAlarmXNObjRecordType varbind will indicate whether this is a new alarm instance or a change to an existing alarm instance. The combination of YangNodeInstance and MajorType/MinorType is always unique and can be used by management systems to correlate alarm, alarm change, and alarm clear. A corresponding row will be created in the Alarm Table, (eriAlarmXActiveAlarmTable). The sequence number will increase for every notification and can be used to detect lost notifications. A management system should be prepared for appending text to additional text, indicated by the eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalText varbind, and sent with eriAlarmXAppendInfo. (Note do not confuse this with a change of additional text.) A management system should be prepared for appending text to additional info, indicated by the eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalInfo varbind, and sent with eriAlarmXAppendInfo. (Note do not confuse this with a change of additional info.) A management system should also be prepared to receive a resource ID (OID) identifying the alarming resource if the system sending the notification can provide that information. In that case, eriAlarmXNObjResourceId will be set to 'true' and the resource ID will be sent in an eriAlarmXAppendInfo notification.

eriAlarmXMinor.name: eriAlarmXMinor
eriAlarmXMinor.description: This notification is sent when a resource detects a new alarm state with severity minor. The notification is also used to change severity, additional text and/or additional info of an alarm. The eriAlarmXNObjRecordType varbind will indicate whether this is a new alarm instance or a change to an existing alarm instance. The combination of YangNodeInstance and MajorType/MinorType is always unique and can be used by management systems to correlate alarm, alarm change, and alarm clear. A corresponding row will be created in the Alarm Table, (eriAlarmXActiveAlarmTable). The sequence number will increase for every notification and can be used to detect lost notifications. A management system should be prepared for appending text to additional text, indicated by the eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalText varbind, and sent with eriAlarmXAppendInfo. (Note do not confuse this with a change of additional text.) A management system should be prepared for appending text to additional info, indicated by the eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalInfo varbind, and sent with eriAlarmXAppendInfo. (Note do not confuse this with a change of additional info.) A management system should also be prepared to receive a resource ID (OID) identifying the alarming resource if the system sending the notification can provide that information. In that case, eriAlarmXNObjResourceId will be set to 'true' and the resource ID will be sent in an eriAlarmXAppendInfo notification.

eriAlarmXMajor.name: eriAlarmXMajor
eriAlarmXMajor.description: This notification is sent when a resource detects a new alarm state with severity major. The notification is also used to change severity, additional text and/or additional info of an alarm. The eriAlarmXNObjRecordType varbind will indicate whether this is a new alarm instance or a change to an existing alarm instance. The combination of YangNodeInstance and MajorType/MinorType is always unique and can be used by management systems to correlate alarm, alarm change, and alarm clear. A corresponding row will be created in the Alarm Table, (eriAlarmXActiveAlarmTable). The sequence number will increase for every notification and can be used to detect lost notifications. A management system should be prepared for appending text to additional text, indicated by the eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalText varbind, and sent with eriAlarmXAppendInfo. (Note do not confuse this with a change of additional text.) A management system should be prepared for appending text to additional info, indicated by the eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalInfo varbind, and sent with eriAlarmXAppendInfo. (Note do not confuse this with a change of additional info.) A management system should also be prepared to receive a resource ID (OID) identifying the alarming resource if the system sending the notification can provide that information. In that case, eriAlarmXNObjResourceId will be set to 'true' and the resource ID will be sent in an eriAlarmXAppendInfo notification.

eriAlarmXCritical.name: eriAlarmXCritical
eriAlarmXCritical.description: This notification is sent when a resource detects a new alarm state with severity critical. The notification is also used to change severity, additional text and/or additional info of an alarm. The eriAlarmXNObjRecordType varbind will indicate whether this is a new alarm instance or a change to an existing alarm instance. The combination of YangNodeInstance and MajorType/MinorType is always unique and can be used by management systems to correlate alarm, alarm change, and alarm clear. A corresponding row will be created in the Alarm Table, (eriAlarmXActiveAlarmTable). The sequence number will increase for every notification and can be used to detect lost notifications. A management system should be prepared for appending text to additional text, indicated by the eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalText varbind, and sent with eriAlarmXAppendInfo. (Note do not confuse this with a change of additional text.) A management system should be prepared for appending text to additional info, indicated by the eriAlarmXNObjMoreAdditionalInfo varbind, and sent with eriAlarmXAppendInfo. (Note do not confuse this with a change of additional info.) A management system should also be prepared to receive a resource ID (OID) identifying the alarming resource if the system sending the notification can provide that information. In that case, eriAlarmXNObjResourceId will be set to 'true' and the resource ID will be sent in an eriAlarmXAppendInfo notification.

eriAlarmXCleared.name: eriAlarmXCleared
eriAlarmXCleared.description: This notification is sent when a resource detects a cleared alarm state. The combination of YangNodeInstance and MajorType/MinorType is always unique and shall be used by management systems to correlate alarm and alarm clear. The corresponding row in the alarm table will be deleted, (eriAlarmXActiveAlarmTable). The sequence number will increase for every notification and can be used to detect lost notifications. Note that it should not be required to send an append trap for a cleared alarm. Those varbinds which flag that an append trap will follow are kept here for backward compatibility reasons.

eriAlarmXAppendInfo.name: eriAlarmXAppendInfo
eriAlarmXAppendInfo.description: This notification is sent in order to append further info to an alarm notification. It might be additional text, additional info or a resource ID (OID) identifying the alarming resource using an OID. If additional text/info is sent, do not confuse this with an actual change of additional text/info which is reported using the eriAlarmX<severity> notification. A zero-length string value for eriAlarmXNObjAdditionalText means that no additional text is being sent in this notification. A zero-length string value for eriAlarmXNObjAppendedAdditionalInfo means that no additional info is being sent in this notification. A null OID (0.0) value for eriAlarmXActiveResourceId means that no resource ID is being sent in this notification.

eriAlarmXIndAlert.name: eriAlarmXIndAlert
eriAlarmXIndAlert.description: This notification is sent when a resource detects a new alert with severity indeterminate. A corresponding row will be created in the Alert Table. The sequence number will increase for every notification and can be used to detect lost notifications.

eriAlarmXWarnAlert.name: eriAlarmXWarnAlert
eriAlarmXWarnAlert.description: This notification is sent when a resource detects a new alert with severity warning. A corresponding row will be created in the Alert Table. The sequence number will increase for every notification and can be used to detect lost notifications.

eriAlarmXMinorAlert.name: eriAlarmXMinorAlert
eriAlarmXMinorAlert.description: This notification is sent when a resource detects a new alert with severity minor. A corresponding row will be created in the Alert Table. The sequence number will increase for every notification and can be used to detect lost notifications.

eriAlarmXMajorAlert.name: eriAlarmXMajorAlert
eriAlarmXMajorAlert.description: This notification is sent when a resource detects a new alert with severity major. A corresponding row will be created in the Alert Table. The sequence number will increase for every notification and can be used to detect lost notifications.

eriAlarmXCriticalAlert.name: eriAlarmXCriticalAlert
eriAlarmXCriticalAlert.description: This notification is sent when a resource detects a new alert with severity critical. A corresponding row will be created in the Alert Table. The sequence number will increase for every notification and can be used to detect lost notifications.

eriAlarmXAppendAlertInfo.name: eriAlarmXAppendAlertInfo
eriAlarmXAppendAlertInfo.description: This notification is sent in order to append further info to an alert notification. It might be additional text or a resource ID (OID) identifying the alarming resource using an OID. This complements information sent in a previous notification. If additional text/info is sent, do not confuse this with an actual change of additional text/info which is reported using the eriAlarmXAlert<severity> notification. A zero-length string value for eriAlarmXNObjAdditionalText means that no additional text is being sent in this notification. A zero-length string value for eriAlarmXNObjAppendedAdditionalInfo means that no additional info is being sent in this notification. A null OID (0.0) value for eriAlarmXAlertResourceId means that no resource ID is being sent in this notification.

eriAlarmXHeartBeatNotif.name: eriAlarmXHeartBeatNotif
eriAlarmXHeartBeatNotif.description: This is a heartbeat notification with interval according to the eriAlarmXHbInterval. It contains the last sequence numbers used for alarms and alarm events. These varbinds can be used to detect lost notifications. The notification eriAlarmXHeartBeatNotif will be sent every eriAlarmXHbInterval. Managers can subscribe to the notification using the SNMP framework MIBS by using the snmpNotifyName 'heartbeat'. (SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB, snmpNotifyTable).

eriAlarmXAlarmListRebuilt.name: eriAlarmXAlarmListRebuilt
eriAlarmXAlarmListRebuilt.description: This notification is sent when the active alarm list has reached a stable situation after a restart or after a system internal audit process. It is an indication to the manager to perform a alarm resynchronization procedure.

eriAlarmXBasicAlarmsCompliance.name: eriAlarmXBasicAlarmsCompliance
eriAlarmXBasicAlarmsCompliance.description: Minimal compliance for the Ericsson Alarm MIB. Minimal compliance is to support heartbeat, active alarm list, and alarm notifications for raise and clear.

eriAlarmXSummaryGroup.name: eriAlarmXSummaryGroup
eriAlarmXSummaryGroup.description: Group containing the summary counters for alarms.

eriAlarmXActiveAlarmsGroup.name: eriAlarmXActiveAlarmsGroup
eriAlarmXActiveAlarmsGroup.description: The group of objects needed to support the active alarm list.

eriAlarmXAlertsGroup.name: eriAlarmXAlertsGroup
eriAlarmXAlertsGroup.description: The group of objects needed to support the alert history.

eriAlarmXHeartBeatGroup.name: eriAlarmXHeartBeatGroup
eriAlarmXHeartBeatGroup.description: Only read is required for compliance

eriAlarmXSNMPResourceGroup.name: eriAlarmXSNMPResourceGroup
eriAlarmXSNMPResourceGroup.description: Objects that support SNMP object identifiers for resource identification.

eriAlarmXChangeAlarmGroup.name: eriAlarmXChangeAlarmGroup
eriAlarmXChangeAlarmGroup.description: Objects that stores previous state of an alarm.

eriAlarmXActiveAlarmsAdditionalInfoGroup.name: eriAlarmXActiveAlarmsAdditionalInfoGroup
eriAlarmXActiveAlarmsAdditionalInfoGroup.description: The group of objects needed to support Additional Information for alarms.

eriAlarmXAlertsAdditionalInfoGroup.name: eriAlarmXAlertsAdditionalInfoGroup
eriAlarmXAlertsAdditionalInfoGroup.description: The group of objects needed to support Additional Information for alerts.

eriAlarmXRecordTypeGroup.name: eriAlarmXRecordTypeGroup
eriAlarmXRecordTypeGroup.description: The group of objects needed to support Record Type for alarms.

eriAlarmXSimpleAlarmGroup.name: eriAlarmXSimpleAlarmGroup
eriAlarmXSimpleAlarmGroup.description: The notifications in this MIB module.

eriAlarmXAddAddInfoGroup.name: eriAlarmXAddAddInfoGroup
eriAlarmXAddAddInfoGroup.description: Notification to support appending of additional text.
